title: 106_hr3890
content: The Act titled "Social Security Benefits Protection Act of 2000" ensures entitlement to benefits for the month of a beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Old-Age Insurance Benefits and Wife's Insurance Benefits, including changes to the month of entitlement and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Husband's Insurance Benefits by redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming amendments to Child's Insurance Benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Child's, Widow's, and Widower's Insurance Benefits by changing the criteria for when benefits end. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust criteria for when benefits end for Widower's, Mother's, Father's, and Parent's Insurance Benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust criteria for when benefits end for Parent's Insurance Benefits, Disability Insurance Benefits, and Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals under the Social Security Act are amended by removing a specific time reference. Additionally, an exemption from the maximum benefit cap is added to Section 203 of the Act. Exemption from maximum benefit cap is granted under section 203 of the Social Security Act, disregarding benefits received under sections 202, 223, or 228 for specific months. Additionally, a limitation on the last monthly payment of insurance benefits is imposed under section 202 for Old-Age and Survivors Insurance. The last payment of monthly insurance benefit is terminated by death, with conditions for payment after the individual's death date. Disability insurance benefits also have provisions for the termination of the last benefit payment upon death. The last payment of monthly insurance benefit is terminated by death, with conditions for payment after the individual's death date. The monthly insurance benefit is terminated upon death, with conditions for payment only if the death occurs after the first 15 days of the month. Benefit payments after death will follow the guidelines of section 204(d). The amendments in this Act apply to deaths occurring after the month of enactment.
